intro: Dombeya ambositrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
